page.title: 01Red Row Northumberland
page.content: Mining has dominated the area, but collieries have closed and huge areas have been torn up by opencast operations. The village and farm of East Chevington have disappeared. Hadston has been extended to house the people concerned. The villages of Red Row, Broomhill and Hadston now merge together, so that housing is almost continuous along the main street. There is some local industry like engineering and farmng continues. The chief employers in the area are opencast mining, mining at Lynemouth and the Alcan Smelter for aluminium. The coastline is most attractive with sandy beaches and sand dunes. Access is being recovered after oepncast operations. North of Hadston woods are being established, with coastal park and lake. The amenities of the coast are
